title: Screenshot 1px border + reliable Internet Identity login in header

requirements.text: In the Press Kit screenshots gallery (frontend/src/pages/PressKitPage.tsx), add a 1-pixel solid black border to every screenshot image in the responsive grid. The border must also apply to the image displayed inside the fullscreen overlay. In dark mode, the border should be 1px solid white (to remain visible against the dark background). The border must be applied directly to the elements via Tailwind classes or inline styles.

quotes: on the screenshots images make 1 pixel black border around them

acceptanceCriteria: Each screenshot thumbnail in the grid has a visible 1px solid black border in light mode
Each screenshot thumbnail in the grid has a visible 1px solid white border in dark mode
The fullscreen overlay image also has the 1px border applied
No other UI elements gain unexpected borders

requirements.text: Rewrite frontend/src/components/Header.tsx from scratch to definitively fix the Internet Identity login button. The component must: (1) import useInternetIdentity from its canonical path 'frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity'; (2) read isAuthenticated (or equivalent identity/principal state) from the hook synchronously at render time — do not gate the button on any async loading flag that delays its appearance; (3) render a 'Sign In' button in the top-right corner (alongside the dark/light theme toggle) whenever isAuthenticated is false; (4) call the hook's login() function on button click to trigger the Internet Identity authentication popup; (5) hide the 'Sign In' button completely once isAuthenticated is true; (6) style the button in the monochrome editorial style — ghost or outlined, black/white/grayscale only, no color accents. The button must be visible on first page load when the user is not logged in, with no delay or flicker caused by initialization guards.

quotes: add a working login / sign in to internet computer to verify admin because it is still not there, already tried two times

acceptanceCriteria: The 'Sign In' button is visible in the top-right corner on first page load when the user has no active Internet Identity session
Clicking 'Sign In' opens the Internet Identity authentication popup
After successful login, the 'Sign In' button disappears from the header
The button is styled monochromatically (no color accents, black/white/grayscale only)
The button appears on all four routes: /, /press-kit, /admin, /admin/settings
No initialization loading guard delays or prevents the button from rendering when unauthenticated

constraints: Do not modify any files listed under frontend.immutablePaths (useInternetIdentity.ts, useActor.ts, main.tsx, components/ui)
Monochrome editorial style must be preserved — no color accents outside #000000, #FFFFFF, and grayscale tones
Do not alter any backend CMS stable variables or logic
nonGoals: Adding new authentication providers beyond Internet Identity
Changing the admin initialization or reset logic
Modifying any other page components beyond Header.tsx and PressKitPage.tsx
Adding borders to any UI elements other than screenshot images
